Detailed Description

template<class DataType>
class DzTBlockArray< DataType >

A template class which embodies an array style list.

This class is very similar to DzTArray, except in the way it stores the items in the list. Instead of storing the entire list in contigous memory, it stores the list in blocks, each time a block is filled, it simply allocates another, avoiding the need to copy its data, and free the previous list. This makes it much more effiecient at creating large lists, though less efficient at accessing them.

Appends a list of items to the end of the array.

template<class DataType>
int DzTBlockArray< DataType >::appendIfUnique ( const DataType &  obj  ) 

If the given item is not in the array, it will be appended to the end of the array, otherwise, the array remains unchanged.

Returns:
The index of the item ( or the first-encountered identical item ) in the array.

template<class DataType >
void DzTBlockArray< DataType >::clear ( bool  freeMem = false  ) 

Removes all items from the list. Actually it just sets the number of items in the list to zero without freeing any space.

template<class DataType>
void DzTBlockArray< DataType >::copyToArray ( DataType *  array  )  const

Copies the contents of this block array into a linear array - be sure to allocate the array to at least count() members.
